name: Bowood Hotel, Spa & Golf Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The grounds are beautiful, even working out at the gym becomes a pleasure with the stunning views outside. The staff are kind and helpful. The rooms are large, comfortable and well equipped. The bar area is lovely. One slight criticism would be that a latte at breakfast is charged for whereas a regular coffee isn't. More effort goes into making a latte but I would have thought that a hotel of this standard this wouldn't be an issue. Other than this I can't fault this hotel.
reviews.title: Perfect stay

reviews.text: We took our family (15 of us!) to lunch last Sunday and had an excellent meal. They gave us a private room overlooking the golf course and thoroughly looked after us. All the staff were really helpful and we had an excellent meal. Well done Bowood!
reviews.title: Excellent Family Lunch

reviews.text: I was given a tea for two voucher as a gift. Felt from start we were not wanted no friendly welcome waited on our own in library for more than twenty minutes. A lady arrived with tea and disappeared that was the last we saw of her the only other person we saw was a man in a suit possibly a manager who did not see fit to say good afternoon. Food scores 8 service 0 what a disappointment.
reviews.title: low tea at bowood hotel

reviews.text: We visited this hotel as a friend was getting married in the Kerry room. We decided to stay at the hotel as we didn't want to travel onwards with a 2 year old in tow.
reviews.title: Luxurious - if a little expensive
Lovely lovely lovely
reviews.text: We were not disappointed. It is a beautiful venue, we stayed in a standard room - which was very luxurious and with plenty of space - despite the additional bed for our daughter (at no extra charge, which we have found to be the case elsewhere).

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nothing will compare to our night at Bowood. From our first greeting to our check out everyone was extremely helpful and friendly. We stayed in a luxurious double room with flat screen tv, power shower and large bath tub. The little touches in each of the rooms, such as the freshly made cookies and variety of drinking facilities made it feel like a home from home. The room was comfy, clean and well decorated and the spa was wonderful! The staff at the spa were helpful and attentive and we felt truly relaxed.
reviews.title: Living in a dream world

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Due to our busy work lives we rarely have an opportunity to fully relax and though we were only away for one night we came home feeling truly happy with our stay.
reviews.title: Beautiful grounds, quirky interior

reviews.text: lovely interior, glam, quirky and modern whilst retaining a sense of heritage. Room was small but perfectly formed. spa was lovely with a great view. The deer grazing, seen from our balcony were a delight. Food was fabulous in restaurant but the restaurant really really lacked atmosphere and was poor in terms of decor by comparison to the rest of the place. Bar was gorgeous with stunning cocktails - we had dessert cocktails after dinner, whipped up by the expert barman!
reviews.title: Valued guests

reviews.text: We've stayed at the Bowood several times before and we have taken a number of friends to eat there too. We were very much looking forward to taking my parents to stay for dinner and overnight on boxing day as a christmas present. Sadly, the night before, my mother who has recently undergone chemotherapy, was taken very ill. It was too late to phone Bowood at midnight on Christmas Day and when we did phone on Boxing Day morning, they were not interested in explainations, interupting my telling them four had become two to draw my attention to the 24 hour rule. They charged us £170 for my parents bed and breakfast. We kind of understood, but felt they could have exerted a little more imagination. We stayed anyway that night as we didn't want to let down the other family who had joined us there for dinner and, apart from the soiled towels in our bedroom (ew), it all seemed ok.
reviews.title: Lovely room, service average

reviews.text: Wouldn't feel very positive about recommending the place though or returning as noone likes to feel treated to quite such impersonal service.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel but a few minor issues with service

reviews.text: Booked an inclusive package of room, dinner, breakfast and 2 rounds of golf through a golf break specialist. Room very good standard, well equipped, and bed very comfortable. Dinner as part of the package was in the brasserie, which is fine for sandwiches and snacks, so paid a small amount to ear in restaurant, which was a very good decision. Portions small but very good quality. Golf course is excellent, well maintained, and all standards, even high handicappers will enjoy the different challenges. Spa looked good to us blokes, and we are planning to return soon with wives.
reviews.title: Great weekend's golf

reviews.text: Luxury rooms, friendly, attentive staff and great food. I would recommend this hotel. I went with some friends for a spa weekend and this is one of the best I have been to. The surroundings are peaceful and quiet, tasteful decoration and the treatments were very good. At the end of the treatments we weren't hasled to buy any products which is a nice change! We all said we will go back!
reviews.title: Relaxing weekend spa break

reviews.text: Visited here again, after three years, and was pleased to find this place still as welcoming, and first class! Rooms were well equipped, and views over golf course were lovely. Bed very comfortable. Cookies in the room a nice touch, we had dinner in the restaurant, and the service and standard of meal was excellent. Would certainly return for a third time. This hotel is in such peaceful grounds, and a very relaxing place to stay.
reviews.title: Another very pleasant stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from a one night two day stay at Bowood. Arrived lunchtime on Sunday and although we were early for check in the reception staff were very helpful. Lunch in the bar although on the expensive side was good. We managed to get in our room earlier than planned. The room was a good size very clean and tidy well decorated and modern. The bathroom which had a separate shower was very spacious and well equipped. We had a room with a balcony, overlooking a golf practice area, the balcony although having 2 chairs on it was very small, and hardly worth the trouble. Played golf in the afternoon, the round took nearly 5 hours as the course was very busy . the course is well laid out and has some challenging holes and greens . The Spa was well equipped and good service from the staff, with a good selection of treatments. We had dinner in the restaurant, which was very nice, the food was a very good standard and service was good.
reviews.title: Weekend break at Bowood hotel and Spa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast on the Monday, was between 0700 and 0930am, which I thought was a little early on the closing time. Arrived for breakfast at 0915 and the cooked breakfast selection I thought was a little sparse with some items looking a little past their best. A selection of fruit, as tries and cereals was also available.
reviews.title: Very nice - but expensive!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Received this as a gift a real nice tea and very filling. The tea was served on time and was very well presented Various sandwiches Scones and cream, and fancy cakes,refills of tea and coffee.
reviews.title: High tea at the bowood hotel

reviews.text: All served in really nice surroundings.One very small gripe we had to use the same plate for salmon sandwiches and to cut our scones etc.But i am sure if i had asked for another the staff would have given me another one
reviews.title: 3rd Stay..... and still getting better

reviews.text: I have just had the pleasure of staying at Bowood for the 3rd time. I was delighted when friends suggested we go there for a Birthday celebration, as we had recommended Bowood to them. The hotel has seen a change of management, and what was already a pleasant experience was surpassed this time. the rooms, as always were great, my only comment was a lack of fridge\mini-bar.
reviews.title: "the coffee bar"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The boys played golf on the championship course (which for the time of year was in very good condition). One of our members needed hire clubs, and was provided with a brand new set of TaylorMade Rocketballz woods & irons (which still had their plastic shipping covers on).... fantastic!
reviews.title: 40th Birthday Surprise

reviews.text: The girls headed for the Spa, and both enjoyed the facilities and a massage (one of the best spa massages ever)
reviews.title: Absolutely Brilliant

aka: Bowood Hotel, Spa And Golf Resort
description: Ideally situated just off the A4 between Calne and Chippenham on the stunning Bowood Estate. All bedrooms and suites are decorated in a Contemporary English Country house style and incorporate plasma screen televisions, internet access and Wi-Fi. Dine in the stunning 82 seat restaurant and have a drink in the duel lounge bar featuring wood burning fires. The spa offers an infinity swimming pool, gym, rock sauna, crystal steam room and aromatherapy showers.
